intro: Erigeron onofrensis, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron onofrensis is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
